node.title: The sprint before the Games: A U.S. speedskater sidelined by Covid tests is on his way to Beijing.
node.description: Casey Dawson, who already missed the 5,000-meter race, is hoping to land hours before the 1,500-meter event takes place, if all goes according to plan.

node.title: "Reading Rainbow Live" debut to feature CBS News' Vladimir Duthiers
node.description: Beloved children's show "Reading Rainbow" is returning in March in its new format.

node.title: I.R.S. to End Use of Facial Recognition for Identity Verification
node.description: The tax collection agency will transition away from using a service from the authentication service ID.me amid bipartisan backlash.

node.title: Hurdle for Kangaroos' adoption of Indigenous war cry cleared by Players' Association
node.description: Australia's national rugby league side the Kangaroos is set to discuss the adoption of the pre-game war cry made famous by the Indigenous All-Stars.

node.title: U.S. skier Nina O'Brien injured after crashing during giant slalom event
node.description: After falling during her race, O'Brien just wanted to know "how fast she was skiing," Team USA said.

node.title: Tribunal win for Gisborne kiwifruit growers
node.description: Kiwifruit growers have won their battle against Gisborne District Council over new rate hikes from producing the golden variety of the fruit.

node.title: Health expert reminds people to get tested for Covid-19 as rates fall
node.description: A public health expert is urging New Zealanders to keep up the testing momentum, as testing rates take a dive over the long weekend.

node.title: Wool industry fears mass exodus as Kiwi shearers pack their bags
node.description: Kiwi shearers in Western Australia are already planning to return to New Zealand after the country announced its border reopening plan.

node.title: Vaccinated tourists welcomed back as Australia to reopen international border
node.description: Almost two years after the Australian government closed the country to the world, the international border is set to reopen to those who are fully vaccinated.

node.title: Peloton stock spikes amid reports of a big-name buyout
node.description: Embattled fitness equipment maker could be buyout target as tech giants and consumer powerhouses reportedly circle it.

node.title: Stacey Abrams criticized after posing maskless next to masked kids
node.description: The Georgia gubernatorial candidate called the criticism "silly" and a "false political attack."

node.title: Florida GOP plans to create election police force, raising alarms
node.description: Cecile Scoon, who runs Florida's nonpartisan League of Women Voters, said the plan is designed to keep minorities from voting.

node.title: Stacey Abrams criticized after posing maskless surrounded by masked children
node.description: The Georgia gubernatorial candidate called the criticism "silly" and a "false political attack."

node.title: Four Havelock North school children test positive for Covid-19
node.description: Four primary school pupils in Havelock North have tested positive for Covid-19, and are being treated as if they have the Omicron variant.

node.title: Statewide mask mandate for New Jersey schools ending in March
node.description: New Jersey was one of just a dozen states with mask mandates in schools, according to the nonpartisan National Academy for State Health Policy.

node.title: Millions of low-income Americans to get tax refund boost
node.description: Childless workers this year can claim an Earned Income Tax Credit worth up to $1,500 â€” triple the usual amount.

node.title: A proud Kiwi celebrates gold medal success
node.description: Zoi Sadowski-Synnott said she was a "proud Kiwi" after winning gold in the women's slopestyle event at the Beijing Olympics, snagging the nation's first-ever Winter Games gold medal.

node.title: Kaleb Franks to plead guilty in alleged Whitmer kidnap plot
node.description: The plea deal outlined in court documents suggests Kaleb Franks could offer crucial testimony against the four remaining defendants in the case.

node.title: Heavy rain warnings extended for parts of North Island
node.description: MetService has extended heavy rain warnings and watches for parts of the North Island to later this evening.

node.title: Today's sports news: What you need to know
node.description: In today's sports news - Hurricanes unveil womens team name, Senegal are African champions and another good win for Phoenix.

node.title: U.S.-born figure skater representing China attacked online after falling during Olympics debut

node.title: A Democrat takes over the F.D.I.C. after a partisan clash.
node.description: Martin J. Gruenberg replaced Jelena McWilliams, a Trump appointee who stepped down after a conflict with Mr. Gruenberg and two other Democratic members on the board.

node.title: Northland police arrest eight; methamphetamine, cash seized
node.description: Police have arrested eight people in Kaitaia and seized a quantity of methamphetamine and cash.

node.title: Winter Olympics: Snowboarder Zoi Sadowski-Synnott wins New Zealand's first ever gold
node.description: New Zealand has claimed its first ever gold medal at the Winter Olympics today, with Zoi Sadowski-Synnott winning the finals of the women's snowboard slopestyle event.

node.title: Police killing of Amir Locke spurs more protests in Minneapolis
node.description: A disturbing police bodycam video shows a SWAT team executing the early-morning warrant after using a key to enter the apartment.

node.title: Mystery of missing WWII soldier from Mississippi solved after 8 decades
node.description: The fate of Private Andrew Ladner had been unknown since he disappeared during World War II, during the Battle of Buna-Gona.

node.title: Five Minimalist Workout-Wear Brands to Know
node.description: To help ease you into the new year, and perhaps a new exercise routine, a roundup of lines offering clothes both functional and fashion-forward.

node.title: Fire Erupts at Brooklyn Building Under Construction
node.description: No injuries were reported, a New York Fire Department spokesman said on Monday. It was unclear whether residents in nearby buildings were required to evacuate.

node.title: Lawmakers press IRS to drop controversial selfie tool ID.me
node.description: Legislators say the tax agency's plan to require photos for people to access their accounts could invite cyberattacks.
